MXP.name: MXP
MXP.description: MXP module for the MXP protocol

MXP.name: MXP
MXP.description: A class MXP Protocol (Message eXchange Protocol)

params.name: sinch
params.description: Create new MXP object for a particular user

params.name: domain
params.description: Error domain

params.name: code
params.description: Error code

params.name: message
params.description: The error message

params.name: object
params.description: Optional object with additional details

MXPLog.name: MXPLog
MXPLog.description: Create a new log message and track description / object as one log item

params.name: message
params.description: Description of Log event

params.name: object
params.description: The associated object relevant for the log item

MXPMessageObj.name: MXPMessageObj
MXPMessageObj.description: Class for holding MXP messages when sending and recieving MXP messages (not IM, but general messages)

params.name: msgObj
params.description: Object to base the new MXPMessageObj from

params.name: opt
params.description: Optional object to get custom parameters from

MXPCryptError.name: MXPCryptError
MXPCryptError.description: A class for MXP Crypt Errors

Call.name: Call
Call.description: A class for managing individual calls. Note: Do not instantiate Call, rather use relevant methods for placing or receiving calls in CallClient. See the examples below.

params.name: sinch
params.description: Create Call for sinch instrance

CallClient.name: CallClient
CallClient.description: The CallClient provides the entry point to the calling functionality of the Sinch SDK. A CallClient can be acquired via the SinchClient. Note: Do not instantiate CallClient, rather use the getCallClient() method in SinchClient. See the example below.

params.name: sinch
params.description: The parent object

CallEndCause.name: CallEndCause
CallEndCause.description: Static class for Call End Causes

GroupCall.name: GroupCall
GroupCall.description: A class for managing group calls. Note: Do not instantiate GroupCall, rather use relevant methods for placing or receiving group calls in CallClient. See the examples below.

params.name: sinch
params.description: Group belongs to this Sinch instrance

params.name: groupChannel
params.description: Name of the channel

params.name: msgObj
params.description: Create new Message based on a MXPMessageObj (incoming) or a regular Object (outgoing).

params.name: fromOther
params.description: Indicate if message is from me.

MessageDeliveryInfo.name: MessageDeliveryInfo
MessageDeliveryInfo.description: A class to contain delivery information for a message

params.name: recipientId
params.description: The recipient to whom the message was delivered

params.name: messageId
params.description: The ID of the delivered message

MessageClient.name: MessageClient
MessageClient.description: The MessageClient provides the entry point to the messaging functionality of the Sinch SDK. A MessageClient can be acquired via the SinchClient. Note: Do not instantiate MessageClient, rather use the getMessageClient() method in SinchClient. See the example below.

params.name: sinch
params.description: The parent object

params.name: domain
params.description: Error domain

params.name: code
params.description: Error code

params.name: message
params.description: The error message

params.name: object
params.description: Optional object with additional details

User.name: User
User.description: Internal class for manging Sinch Users

params.name: sinch
params.description: A reference to a SinchClient object this object belongs to.

Verification.name: Verification
Verification.description: Provides Verification over SMS. Note: Do not instantiate Verification, rather use the createSmsVerification() method in SinchClient. See the example below.

params.name: sinch
params.description: The parent object

params.name: number
params.description: The phone number to verify

params.name: custom
params.description: Custom string to pass to your backend through callback. Useful for identifying user session, or similar. Max size is 4 kbyte.

SinchClient.name: SinchClient
SinchClient.description: The SinchClient is the Sinch SDK entry point. It provides access to the feature classes in the Sinch SDK: MessageClient, and other in future. It is also used to configure user's and device's capabilities. The user IDs that are used to identify users application specific. If the app already has a scheme for user IDs (email addresses, phone numbers, customer numbers, etc.), the same ID could be used when configuring the SinchClient.

params.name: configObj
params.description: Configuration options for Sinch

props.name: messaging
props.description: Enable IM by setting this to true

props.name: calling
props.description: Enable data calling by setting this to true

props.name: multiCall
props.description: Enable multiple concurrent calls by setting this to true

props.name: video
props.description: Enable video calling by setting this to true (Beta)

props.name: supportActiveConnection
props.description: Support the online capability, receiving notifications over an active connection in addition to push (where available)

props.name: startActiveConnection
props.description: Automatically support online capability & start connection to listen for IM and data calls

props.name: onLogMessage
props.description: Callback to handle detailed log messages

params.name: step
params.description: Current step

params.name: totalSteps
params.description: Total steps in a chain

params.name: message
params.description: The notification message

params.name: object
params.description: Optional object with additional details

classitems.description: Collect MXP Frames for a particular incoming message / set of messages.

return.description: promise which resolves a new message consisting of all frames

classitems.description: Identify decryption key for a complete MXP message (headers + defragmented content + footers). Analyzes if message was encrypted using a transport key, signal key or instance key.
classitems.name: identifyKey

params.name: assembledMessage
params.description: A complete MXP message.

return.description: promise which resolves into a new  with all correct initial data.

classitems.description: Handle decrypted message and pass to the right set of handlers as specified by other parts of the MXP protocol. (i.e., MXPCalling or MXPMessaging)

params.name: msgObj
params.description: The message to handle

classitems.description: Handle error messages by logging + writing to console if there's an error stack

params.description: The error message or object

classitems.description: Method to retrieve transport by transportId or recipientId's, can be used in a chan with MXPMessageObj as input/output

classitems.description: Send MXP Message as defined by the incoming msgObj {MXPMessageObj}

params.name: msgObj

return.description: promise which resolves into the updated message object

classitems.description: Split a full MXP message into many frames. Resulting frames stored in the {MXPMessageObj}

classitems.description:
Add event listeners to the call, multiple listeners can be added with this method. 
Listeners are processed in the order they're added. 
Listeners can be removed, using the removeEventListener method.
classitems.name: addEventListener

params.name: eventListener
params.description: An object containing a set of listeners for various actions

props.name: onCallProgressing
props.description: Callback for calls progressing, this is where to start playing any ringtones.

props.name: onCallEstablished
props.description: Callback for established calls, this is where to start playing the media streams and stop playing any ringtones.

props.name: onCallEnded
props.description: Callback for calls which are ended, media stream as well as ringtones should stop here.

props.name: onDataChannelAdded
props.description: Callback for datachannel added will pass call object ("this") as first parameter and the dataChannel as second. (Beta)

classitems.description: Remove event lister objects from the call. Pass the same object as was used when adding the listener.
classitems.name: removeEventListener

params.name: eventListener
params.description: An object containing a set of listeners for various actions, that has previously been added to this callClient

example:
call.addEventListener(myListener);
	call.removeEventListener(myListener);

classitems.description: Internal: Set media streams, this is used internally by the call object. Internal function!
classitems.name: setStream

classitems.description: Internal: Execute a specific listener and pass argument dataObj. Only used internally.
classitems.name: execListener

classitems.description: Internal: Set call end cause. Only used internally.
classitems.name: setEndCause

classitems.description: Internal: Set participants in the ongoing call. Only used internally.
classitems.name: setParticipants

classitems.description: Internal: Change call state to PROGRESSING and do necessary related steps. Only used internally.
classitems.name: progress

classitems.description: Internal: Change call state to ESTABLISHED and do necessary related steps. Only used internally.
classitems.name: establish

classitems.description: Internal: Trigger actions based on MXP ACK message. Only used internally.
classitems.name: mxpAck

classitems.description: Internal: Trigger actions based on MXP Sdp Answer. Only used internally.
classitems.name: processRTCAnswer

classitems.description: Internal: Process a mxpPeerEventSdp. Only used internally.
classitems.name: mxpPeerEventSdp

classitems.description: Internal: Trigger actions based on ICE CANDIDATE. Only used internally.
classitems.name: mxpInjectIce

classitems.description: Internal: Internal method to inject ICE in PC. Only used internally.
classitems.name: injectIce

classitems.description: Internal: Trigger actions based on MXP JOIN message. Only used internally.
classitems.name: mxpJoin

classitems.description: Internal: Trigger actions based on MXP JOIN message. Only used internally.
classitems.name: mxpJoined

classitems.description: Internal: Trigger actions based on MXP HANGUP message. Only used internally.
classitems.name: mxpHangup

classitems.description: Internal: Trigger actions based on MXP DENY message. Only used internally.
classitems.name: mxpDeny

classitems.description: Internal: Trigger actions based on MXP CANCEL message. Only used internally.
classitems.name: mxpCancel

classitems.description: Internal: Trigger actions based on MXP FAIL message. Only used internally.
classitems.name: mxpFail

classitems.description: Internal: Fail a current call, used in various error scenarios. Only used internally.
classitems.name: callFailure

classitems.description: Internal: Prototype used in call when adding callbacks to data channels. Only used internally.
classitems.name: addEventListenerPrototype

classitems.description: Internal: Initialize peer connection and configure all callbacks. Only used internally.
classitems.name: initPC

classitems.description: Internal: Start a call. Only used internally.
classitems.name: placeCall

classitems.description: Internal: Recieve a call, do not use this directly! Only used internally.
classitems.name: ackIncomingCall

classitems.description: Pick up an incoming call which is currently ringing.
classitems.name: answer

classitems.description: Beta: Open data channel on ongoing call session. Can only be used with "new" data clients (i.e., not PSTN).
classitems.name: openDataChannel

params.name: label
params.description: Name of data channel

classitems.description: End the call, regardless of what state it is in. If the call is an incoming call that has not yet been answered, the call will be reported as denied to the caller.
classitems.name: hangup

classitems.description: Returns the call identifier.
classitems.name: getCallId

classitems.description: Returns metadata about the call.
classitems.name: getDetails

return.description: Object containing metadata about the call.

classitems.description: Returns the call direction of the call.
classitems.name: getDirection

return.description: bool True for outgoing, false for incoming.

classitems.description: Returns the identifier of the remote participant in the call.
classitems.name: getRemoteUserId

return.description: Identifier of the remote participant in the call.

classitems.description: Returns the Call State the call is currently in.
classitems.name: getState

classitems.description: Returns the Call End Cause for the call
classitems.name: getEndCause

classitems.description: Returns the Call Headers for this call
classitems.name: getHeaders

return.description: Call headers passed with the call

classitems.description: Sends one or more DTMF tones for tone dialing.
classitems.name: sendDTMF

params.name: keys
params.description: May be a series of DTMF keys. Each key must be in [0-9, #, *, A-D].

classitems.description: Mute microphone in ongoing call. Must be active call.
classitems.name: mute

classitems.description: Un-mute microphone in ongoing call. Must be active call.
classitems.name: unmute

classitems.description:
Add event listeners to the callClient, multiple listeners can be added with this method. Listeners are processed in the order they're added. 
Listeners can be removed, using the CallClient.removeEventListener method.
classitems.name: addEventListener

params.name: eventListener
params.description: An object containing a set of listeners for various actions

classitems.description: Remove event lister objects from the callClient. Pass the same object as was used when adding the listeners.
classitems.name: removeEventListener

params.name: eventListener
params.description: An object containing a set of listeners for various actions, that has previously been added to this callClient

example:
callClient.addEventListener(myListener);
	callClient.removeEventListener(myListener);

classitems.description: Initialize media streams, this is used to create the stream from the microphone. The stream will be cached; in order to avoid a question when making / receiving a call, run initStream() once when it's a good time in the application flow. Note: This can be used to initialize the stream before it's needed, for example, during application loading.
classitems.name: initStream

return.description: promise which resolves into a media stream

classitems.description: Check whether we're already in a call.
classitems.name: alreadyInCall

params.name: msgObj
params.description: Incoming invite describing the call

classitems.description: Handle incoming call.
classitems.name: handleIncomingCall

params.name: msgObj
params.description: Incoming invite describing the call

classitems.description: Calls the user with the given userId. Note: Remember to play the audio in an audio element. When adding the incoming audio source, remember to play back the stream, or use the attribute "autoplay" on the audio element.
classitems.name: callUser

params.name: userId
params.description: The specific id of the user to call. May not be null or empty.

params.name: headers
params.description: Header object, contains a map key-value. Only string values are supported in native clients.

params.name: customStream
params.description: Custom audio stream to transmit. If none is specified, the stream from the mic will be used.

return.description: Call instance for adding event handlers and/or interacting with this call.

classitems.description: Calls a phone number and terminate the call to the PSTN-network (Publicly Switched Telephone Network). Note: Remember to play the audio in an audio element. When adding the incoming audio source, remember to play back the stream, or use the attribute "autoplay" on the audio element.
classitems.name: callPhoneNumber

params.name: phoneNumber
params.description: The phone number to call. The phone number should be given according to E.164 number formatting (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/E.164) and should be prefixed with a '+'. E.g. to call the US phone number 415 555 0101, it should be specified as "+14155550101", where the '+' is the required prefix and the US country code '1' added before the local subscriber number.

params.name: headers
params.description: Header object (map key-value)

params.name: customStream
params.description: Custom audio stream to transmit. If none is specified, the stream from the mic will be used.

return.description: Call instance for adding event handlers and/or interacting with this call.

classitems.description: Calls a conference room, all calls connected to the same room will exchange voice traffic and can also be reached from PSTN. (Voice only) Note: Remember to play the audio in an audio element. When adding the incoming audio source, remember to play back the stream, or use the attribute "autoplay" on the audio element.
classitems.name: callPhoneNumber

params.name: conferenceId
params.description: The conference room to call.

params.name: headers
params.description: Header object (map key-value)

params.name: customStream
params.description: Custom audio stream to transmit. If none is specified, the stream from the mic will be used.

return.description: Call instance for adding event handlers and/or interacting with this call.

classitems.description:
Beta: Join a call group, works with both video and audio. Currently only p2p conferencing works, where each participant is streaming to all other participants. Note: Remember to play the media in a audio/video element. When adding the incoming media source, remember to play back the stream, or use the attribute "autoplay" on the audio element.
Note: Also requires the "multiCall" capability set to true. For video, also set the "video" capability to true.
classitems.name: callGroup

params.name: groupName
params.description: The name of the group to join

return.description: Call Group for adding event handlers related to this group conversation.

classitems.description: Call is initiating.
classitems.name: INITIATING

classitems.description:
Call is progressing, during this state, you might want to play a ringtone.
The event 'onCallProgressing' will be called on transition to this CallState.
classitems.name: PROGRESSING

classitems.description:
Call is established, during this phase the ringtone should not play and instead the stream referenced in `incomingStream`, in the call object, should be played in an audio element.
The event 'onCallEstablished' will be called on transition to this CallState.
classitems.name: ESTABLISHED

classitems.description:
Call is ended. The end cause can be found using callEndCause() method in the call object.
The event 'onCallEnded' will be called on transition to this CallState.
classitems.name: ENDED

classitems.description: This is the case if the user (the own client) cancels the call before it was answered.
classitems.name: CANCELED

classitems.description: The call was either busy or denied.
classitems.name: DENIED

classitems.description: There was some failure in the internal sinch infrastructure.
classitems.name: FAILURE

classitems.description: There was a successful call, which either side hung up on.
classitems.name: HUNG_UP

classitems.description: The call was ringing for a long time without anyone answering. (~45 seconds)
classitems.name: NO_ANSWER

classitems.description: The call has not yet ended.
classitems.name: NONE

classitems.description:
Add event listeners to the groupCall, multiple listeners can be added with this method. Listeners are processed in the order they're added. 
Listeners can be removed, using the groupCall.removeEventListener method.
classitems.name: addEventListener

params.name: eventListener
params.description: An object containing a set of listeners for various actions

props.name: onGroupLocalMediaAdded
props.description: Callback for taking action on local stream, such as adding it to a media element in the DOM.

props.name: onGroupRemoteCallAdded
props.description: Callback for taking action on new participant. Such as adding it's stream to a media element.

props.name: onGroupRemoteCallRemoved
props.description: Callback for taking action removing a participant stream from the DOM.

classitems.description: Remove event lister objects from the groupCall. Pass the same object as was used when adding the listeners.
classitems.name: removeEventListener

params.name: eventListener
params.description: An object containing a set of listeners for various actions, that has previously been added to this groupCall

classitems.description: End the group call, regardless of which state it's in. It will close the connection to all participants gracefully and then reset the callClient to be ready for a new group call.
classitems.name: hangupGroup

classitems.description: Id of message
classitems.name: messageId

classitems.description: Array of usernames for recipients. Array with one item if there's only one recipient.
classitems.name: recipientIds

classitems.description: Text body of message
classitems.name: textBody

classitems.description: Username for sender of this message
classitems.name: senderId

classitems.description: Custom headers for message
classitems.name: headers

classitems.description: Local javascript time when message was created
classitems.name: timestamp

classitems.description: Array of recipients which have acknowledged delivery of their message.
classitems.name: delivered

classitems.description: True if outgoing (from myself) or false for incoming (from other user)
classitems.name: direction

classitems.description: A method to clone this {Message} object into a new {MXPMessageObj}
classitems.name: getMXPMessageObj

classitems.description: Id of message that was delivered
classitems.name: messageId

classitems.description: Id of recipient who acknowledged delivery
classitems.name: recipientId

classitems.description: Local javascript time when delivery of message was known.
classitems.name: timestamp

classitems.description: Internal method to handle incoming message and take appropriate actions wrt. handlers / errors. Capable of recieving both loop-back messages from self and external messages.
classitems.name: handleMessage

params.name: msgObj
params.description: Arriving object to be processed.

return.description: Boolean defining if ack should be sent

classitems.description:
External method to add event listeners to the messageClient, multiple listeners can be added with this method. Listeners are processed in the order they're added. 
Listeners can be removed, using the MessageClient method.
classitems.name: addEventListener

params.name: eventListener
params.description: An object containing a set of listeners for various actions

classitems.description: External method to remove event lister objects from the messageClient. Pass the same object as was used when adding the listeners.
classitems.name: removeEventListener

params.name: eventListener
params.description: An object containing a set of listeners for various actions, that has previously been added to this messageClient

example:
messageClient.addEventListener(myListeners);
	messageClient.removeEventListener(myListeners);

classitems.description: Send an instant message. Can either be chained or supplied with success/fail callbacks. A promise will always be returned, supplied callback functions will be called before chained functions. _Note: If a user does not exist or a user is lacking the capability to receive your message, the error returned will inform you of what failed. Code 2000 for missing person, code 2001 for missing capability. The user(s) in question can be found in the error.response array._
classitems.name: send

params.name: message
params.description: The message object to send

params.name: success
params.description: Callback for successfuly sent message (n.b. not necessarily delivered yet)

params.name: fail
params.description: Callback for send error

return.description: promise which resolves with the message

classitems.description: Internal method to take actions on reception of ack, for example, calling onDelivery handlers.
classitems.name: ackMsg

params.name: recipientId
params.description: The id of the party sending the acknowledgement

params.name: messageId
params.description: the id of the message which was acknowledged

classitems.description: Removes a previous added eventListener object. Note: Do not send the same Message object more than once.
classitems.name: newMessage

params.name: recipientIds
params.description: Array or string containing one or more recipientId's to send a message to.

params.name: textBody
params.description: The message body to send

params.name: publicHeaders
params.description: Opaque object sent with the message which can be inspected on the receiver side via Message.headers

classitems.description: Error domain
classitems.name: domain

classitems.description: Error code
classitems.name: code

classitems.description: Object relevant to the cause of the error, typically a response on a REST request
classitems.name: response

classitems.description: Text message (human readable)
classitems.name: message

classitems.description: Error stack
classitems.name: stack

classitems.description: User object with some fundamental information and the user profile. Contents may vary.
classitems.name: userObj

classitems.description: SinchClient instance this user belongs to
classitems.name: sinch

classitems.description: Internal method to update user profile
classitems.name: updateUser
classitems.tagname:
param {Object} userObj Objecte describing the user, can contain only the fields to be updated. To remove a field, supply an empty string. 
param {Object} [userObj.first] User first name
param {Object} [userObj.lsat] User last name

return.description: promise which resolves to the new user object on success

classitems.description: Internal method to create a new user, retrieves authentication ticket.
classitems.name: create

params.name: signupObj
params.description: Object with details on the user. One or more of email/username/number must be specifieed.

return.description: promise which resolves to an object containing the user and authorization ticket

classitems.description: Internal method to authenticate and store user data in the user object
classitems.name: authenticate

params.name: loginObj
params.description: Object containing a userObject with auth ticket, or a loginObj specifying password and one of username, number or email.

props.name: expiresIn
props.description: The desired TTL of a session, in seconds. Default is 24 hours.

return.description: promise which resolves null on success

classitems.description:
Internal method to retrieve instance (key & secret for signed requests), key and secret stored in {SinchClient} object. 
(Previously sessions where used, hence the name. TODO: Rename function to something with instances)
classitems.name: initSessKeySecret

return.description: promise which resolves null on success

classitems.description: Internal method to resume a session.
classitems.name: resumeSession

return.description: promise which resolves null on success

classitems.description: Internal method to retrieve MXP user configuration from PAPI. Configuration is store it in "this"
classitems.name: getMXPConf

return.description: promise which resolves null on success

classitems.description: Request a verification - Internal method, do not use
classitems.name: request

params.name: success
params.description: Optional success callback

params.name: fail
params.description: Optional fail callback

return.description: promise - Promise which resulves when request is successful, fail resolves with VerificationError

classitems.description: Verify a code retrieved over a secondary channel. Pass in code, success and fail callbacks, or rely on promises. Note: The code for a particular verification session can only attempt verification at most five times.
classitems.name: verify

params.name: code
params.description: Mandatory code to verify, this code should have been retrieved from the user (who got it through SMS)

params.name: success
params.description: Optional success callback, method also returns a promise for chaining

params.name: fail
params.description: Optional fail callback, method also returns a promise for chaining

return.description: promise Promise which resolves when verified, fail resolves with VerificationError

classitems.description: Initiate verification by requesting an SMS with secret code to be sent to the phone number provided earlier. Returns promise which is resolved when initiated. Note: This method can be called multiple times, in case user requests re-sending the SMS.
classitems.name: initiate

params.name: success
params.description: Optional success callback, method also returns a promise for chaining

params.name: fail
params.description: Optional fail callback, method also returns a promise for chaining

return.description: promise Promise which resolves when verified, fail resolves with VerificationError

classitems.description: Retry verification by re-sending a new verification SMS. Returns promise which is resolved when verified.
classitems.name: retry

params.name: success
params.description: Optional success callback

params.name: fail
params.description: Optional fail callback

return.description: promise Promise which resolves when verified, fail resolves with VerificationError

classitems.description: Configure Sinch application key and session id / secret.
classitems.name: config

params.name: credentialsObj
params.description: Object with application credentials.

props.name: authServer
props.description: Callback URL for authentication ticket, if not using default identity provider from Sinch.

example: var sinchClient = Sinch

classitems.description: Sinch log function, calls developer supplied log handler and optionally report progress on a defer
classitems.name: log

params.name: message
params.description: The message to log, can be object or string

params.name: promise
params.description: The promise to notify

classitems.description: Sinch log MXP function, calls developer supplied MXP log handler, for tracing MXP messages.
classitems.name: log

params.name: message
params.description: The message to log, can be object or string

classitems.description: Configure Sinch application URL.
classitems.name: setUrl

params.name: urlObj
params.description: Object with backend PAPI URL's.

classitems.description: Terminate session, invalidates sinchClient and this object is considered stale; instance can't be reused.
classitems.name: terminate

classitems.description:
Add authorization header using "session"-method and return modified header object for signed session requests (fallback to non-signed application key).
Can be sent using jQuery. If using AngularJS, intercept and sign requests before they are sent.
classitems.name: signSession

params.name: configObj
params.description: Object describing the request.

props.name: data
props.description: Raw data object to be sent (if any)

props.name: headers
props.description: Object containing header fields (only 'Accept' is required)

classitems.description:
Add authorization header using "ticket"-method and return modified header object.
Can be sent using jQuery. If using AngularJS, intercept and sign requests before they are sent.
classitems.name: signTicket

params.name: configObj
params.description: Object describing the request.

props.name: data
props.description: Raw data object to be sent (if any)

props.name: headers
props.description: Object containing header fields (only 'Accept' is required)

classitems.description: Add authorization header for non signed request, using only the application key for public / open functions.
classitems.name: signApp

params.name: configObj
params.description: Object describing the request.

props.name: headers
props.description: Object containing header fields (only 'Accept' is required)

classitems.description: Retrieve session id and secret
classitems.name: getSession
example:
var sessionObj = sinchClient.getSession();
	sessionStorage['sinchSession'] = sessionObj;

classitems.description: Create a new user. Can either be chained or supplied with success/fail callbacks. A promise will always be returned, supplied callback functions will be called before chained functions.
classitems.name: newUser

params.name: signupObj
params.description: Object describing the new user, must contain one or more of username, email or number identity

params.name: success
params.description: Callback on Success

params.name: fail
params.description: Callback on Error

return.description: promise which resolves with an authentication ticket on success, which can be supplied to the start method.

classitems.description: Initialize the SDK using a loginObject or supplied ticket. Can either be chained or supplied with success/fail callbacks. A promise will always be returned, supplied callback functions will be called before chained functions.
classitems.name: start

params.name: loginObj
params.description: Object containing details for authentication or authenticated object from creating new user or third party authentication.

props.name: email
props.description: Authenticate using email (password is mandatory when supplying this)

props.name: number
props.description: Authenticate using number (password is mandatory when supplying this)

props.name: username
props.description: Authenticate using username (password is mandatory when supplying this)

props.name: userTicket
props.description: Authentication ticket signed with your app secret. User identity or password is not required if this is supplied together with the user profile.

params.name: success
params.description: Callback on Success

params.name: fail
params.description: Callback on Error

return.description: promise which resolves to null on success

classitems.description: Retrieve a MessageClient for a particular sinchClient. Requires a sinchClient with messaging capability set true.
classitems.name: getMessageClient
example: var messageClient = sinchClient.getMessageClient();

classitems.description: Retrieve a CallClient for a particular sinchClient. Requires a sinchClient with calling capability set true.
classitems.name: getCallClient
example: var callClient = sinchClient.getCallClient();

classitems.description: Create a Verification for a particular sinchClient.
classitems.name: createSmsVerification

params.name: number
params.description: Phone number to verify, give in E.164 format (i.e. +1800123456)

params.name: custom
params.description: Custom string to pass to your backend through callback. Useful for identifying user session, or similar. Max size is 4 kbyte.

example: var verification = sinchClient.createSmsVerification(phoneNumber);

classitems.description: Start connection for messages and data call signalling.
classitems.name: startActiveConnection

return.description: promise which resolves when connection is active.

example: sinchClient.startActiveConnection();

classitems.description: Stop connection for messages and data call signalling.
classitems.name: stopActiveConnection
example: sinchClient.stopActiveConnection();

classitems.description: Retrieve the current version of the Sinch JS SDK
classitems.name: getVersion
example: var version = sinchClient.getVersion();

classitems.description: Make AJAX request using XMLHttpRequest
classitems.name: sinchAjax

classitems.description: Prototype PAPI request method, used in Sinch class to generate all PAPI methods as defined in PAPI/*_defs
classitems.name: requestPrototype

classitems.description: Generate and retrieve a random UUID
classitems.name: getUuid

classitems.description: Retrieve browser version (Vendor + Version)
classitems.name: getBrowserInfo

classitems.description: Retrieve type of OS
classitems.name: getOsVersion
